column4: hey, my shitty ISP won't let me access IRC, any way around it? it's only at work, I have another box at home running windows on another ISP
this is my laptop by the way
I think so, I can use ssh probably
second question, I installed hebrew support, it worked before but stopped working when I got XGL it stopped working in gnome (still working in KDE), is there any way to fix that?
it's not XGL related, it's language support related
I need to get alt+shift to switch languages again
ok, anyone, how do I change the shortcut that changes languages, or at least get an icon up that lets you choose
what is the language changing shortcut you speak of
I need alt+shift to change languages like it used to
how did you get alt+shift to change languages in the first place?
what was the commad that shortcut executed
that is a problem, until you can figure the command out, it will be hard to figure out how to recover it
yes, I can get hebrew when I change my default layout to hebrew and move it to first in keyboard prefrences
